headline: Stage-specific upregulation in adipose tissue and procyclic forms with S-phase cell cycle peak
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene shows dynamic stage-specific expression patterns across Trypanosoma brucei life cycle stages and tissues.
  • Exhibits highest upregulation in adipose tissue (6-fold vs bloodstream forms) and moderate upregulation in procyclic forms (3-fold vs bloodstream forms)
  • Displays cell cycle-dependent expression with peak abundance during S-phase, suggesting involvement in DNA synthesis processes
  • Shows consistent enrichment in spliced leader-containing transcripts rather than primary transcription initiation
The gene belongs to a 3-member paralog family, which may indicate functional redundancy or specialization. The coordinated upregulation in non-bloodstream environments (adipose tissue, insect stages) and during DNA replication suggests this gene may facilitate metabolic adaptation or DNA-related processes during parasite development and tissue colonization.

topics.headline: Tissue and life cycle stage-specific expression patterns
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistent upregulation in non-bloodstream environments, with 6-fold higher expression in adipose tissue and 3-fold higher expression in procyclic forms compared to bloodstream forms.

topics.headline: Cell cycle-dependent expression during DNA synthesis
topics.one_sentence_summary: Gene expression peaks during S-phase of the cell cycle with moderate upregulation compared to G1 and G2 phases, indicating involvement in DNA synthesis processes.

topics.headline: RNA processing and transcript stability regulation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows enrichment in spliced leader-containing transcripts and altered stability in XRNA mutants, suggesting regulation through RNA processing and degradation pathways.
